question_sentence: Arab nations have adopted a plan to rebuild Gaza submitted by which country?
evidence: Submitted by Egyptian President Abdel Fattah el-Sisi, "Gaza 2030" was approved at an emergency summit of the Arab League in Cairo on Tuesday. The so-called "Arab plan" is a direct rival to Donald Trump's controversial vision of a "Middle East Riviera" in Gaza.

question_sentence: British paediatricians have said parents should not be allowed to do what to their children?
evidence: The Royal College of Paediatrics and Child Health said that smacking children is a "Victorian-era punishment" that "undoubtedly harms children's health". Scotland and Wales have already banned all corporal punishment, but "reasonable" chastisement is still protected in England.

question_sentence: Which finance firm has abandoned a rebrand that saw it remove vowels from its name?
evidence: After four years as Abrdn, the Scottish asset management firm – confusingly headquartered in Edinburgh – announced it would revert to its original name. The rebrand was intended to emphasise the company's digital credentials, but met with widespread derision. Chief executive Jason Windsor admitted the vowel-less name had caused "distractions".

question_sentence: Which YouTube-famous bald eagles have welcomed hatchlings?
evidence: The pair of bald eagles in Big Bear, California, welcomed two hatchlings this week, delighting viewers worldwide who followed the couple through the Friends of Big Bear Valley YouTube livestream. This joyful moment came after a series of setbacks, including lost eggs and brutal weather conditions.

question_sentence: Which actor broke the record for longest acceptance speech in the history of the Academy Awards last Sunday?
evidence: After winning best actor (for the second time) for the lead role in "The Brutalist", Brody spoke for a bum-numbing five minutes and 40 seconds. The historical drama, which also won best cinematography and best original score, was widely tipped for best picture but lost out to "Anora".

question_sentence: Which store is facing a 40-day boycott?
evidence: The popular US retailer is facing a 40-day consumer boycott that started on Wednesday over its shift away from diversity, equity and inclusion policies. "We are asking people to divest from Target because they have turned their back on our community," said Rev. Jamal Bryant, an Atlanta megachurch pastor who initiated the boycott.

question_sentence: According to a new report, which city now has the highest number of restaurants serving the world's top wines?
evidence: The annual Wealth Report by estate agency Knight Frank revealed that London now boasts 519 restaurants serving wines from the world's best wine and champagne houses, putting it ahead of New York (480) and Paris (414).

question_sentence: Which country's parliament descended into chaos after opposition lawmakers set off smoke grenades during a meeting?
evidence: Serbia's parliamentary session on university funding on Tuesday descended into chaos when opposition MPs threw smoke grenades, eggs and flares while calling for Prime Minister Miloš Vučević's resignation. This demand is part of a long-standing protest movement linking Vučević to a fatal railway station disaster.

question_sentence: This week saw the release of a long-awaited new novel by which celebrated author?
evidence: "Dream Count" tells the story of four African women navigating love, trauma, regret and societal pressures. It is the Nigerian writer's fourth novel, published 12 years after her third, 2013's "Americanah". In between she has written a memoir, two essays on feminism and a children's book.

question_sentence: Actor Jane Fonda revealed that she scared off which animal after it got close to her young grandson's cot?
evidence: Fonda, now 87, said that more than 20 years ago she woke to strange noises in the night and discovered a bear sniffing around her grandson's cot when he was staying at her New Mexico home. She roared and raised her arms to appear larger, eventually scaring the bear off, though not before it urinated on her rug.

question_sentence: Which global leader recently had a fiery argument with President Donald Trump in the Oval Office?
evidence: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky this week described his tense Oval Office meeting with President Trump as “regrettable,” noting that Ukraine is ready to negotiate peace.

question_sentence: Which state is working to contain a measles outbreak that has grown to at least 159 cases?
evidence: The CDC is on the ground in Texas responding to a measles outbreak. Most of the cases are in Gaines County, in eastern Texas, which is home to a large unvaccinated Mennonite population.

question_sentence: Which US retailer is facing a 40-day consumer boycott?
evidence: Target is facing a major consumer boycott that began Wednesday over the company’s shift away from diversity, equity and inclusion (DEI) policies.

question_sentence: Hollywood’s glitz and glamour were on full display at the 97th Academy Awards in Los Angeles. Which film took home five trophies, including for best picture?
evidence: Independent film “Anora” came out on top for the night. It picked up five Oscars total, including for writing, editing and directing.

question_sentence: Pope Francis is trying to recover from episodes of respiratory failure. How old is the pontiff?
evidence: The 88-year-old pontiff has been hospitalized since mid-February due to pneumonia and lung-related issues. His current hospitalization is his fourth — and now longest stay since he became pope in 2013.

question_sentence: A lunar lander successfully touched down on the moon days ago. What was its name?
evidence: An uncrewed spacecraft called Blue Ghost successfully landed on the moon, making Texas-based Firefly Aerospace only the second private-sector company ever to complete such a feat.

question_sentence: Which countries were hit with 25% tariffs on imports of most US goods?
evidence: President Trump this week imposed 25% tariffs on Mexico and Canada, and doubled the tariff on all Chinese imports to 20% from 10%. Then he delayed some of the tariffs after his plan rattled markets, lawmakers and consumers.

question_sentence: Which state became the first to pass legislation requiring app stores to verify users’ ages before they can download certain apps?
evidence: Utah on Wednesday became the first state to pass legislation requiring app stores to verify users’ ages and get parental consent for minors to download apps to their devices.

question_sentence: Who recently became the first player in NBA history to score 50,000 career points?
evidence: The NBA’s all-time leading scorer LeBron James became the first player in NBA history to reach 50,000 career points across both the regular season and playoffs.

question_sentence: Which country will host the 2026 World Cup?
evidence: The world is coming to America for next summer’s soccer showpiece — but there are big concerns over whether the US is ready.
